page.title: 15LOCAL HISTORY, HOUSES
page.content: Interesting Houses The two most important 'big' houses in Bulls Cross are Forty Hall and Myddelton House. Forty Hall is surrounded by parkland and trees at the top of Forty Hill. It is now owned by the Council as a public recreation area. The house itself has a small museum and often has paintings or photographic displays. In the summer there are open-air plays to watch or music to listen to. Quite close was the site of the old Elsynge Palace but nothing remains now. Worcester Lodge, Longbourne, Clock House and Elsynge too are often photographed. These and some ordinary houses and a row of just six shops, with a church and a school make up the village of Forty Hill.
